title: Help With Modern Sans Serif, Please!
content:
I am looking for an very modern sans serif with sharp edges. Not the an expert by any means with typeface jargon, but I'll try to explain.

I am currently using Gotham from Hoefler & Frere-Jones, however the squared tops and bottoms on some of the letters does not flow well with the mark I designed. Along with a sample of Gotham (top image), I uploaded two that have more of these sharp points on the edges of all the letters. Notice specifically on the M, N, A, etc. that the points come to a much sharper edge. It also needs to look good in a heavier weight.

Can you identify these or recommend any that are similar?

Many thanks in advance!

comments.content: You are liking Neutraface from House Industries.

Geometric 415 (a.k.a. Metroblack) has the pointed tops too

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141019142655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/")

also check out Mostra

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141019142655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/")

If you like them for display-purposes try [Typeface 6+7](http://web.archive.org/web/20141019142655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-typeface-6-and-7/) by Neville Brody or read [this Cityof-discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20141019142655/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=11230) over there …
You are looking for pointed apexes. Consider also [Relay](http://web.archive.org/web/20141019142655/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/relay/).

And, of course, Futura in the weights up to Medium.
